intro: Metastelma occidentale, commonly known as the western metastelma, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related genera. The plant typically grows as a low shrub with woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and often have a distinctive pink or purple coloration. The plant is adapted to drought conditions, with deep roots and a thick, waxy cuticle to reduce water loss.
